pages.content:
[HEADING] Engineering
[HEADING] Engineering
[HEADING] School of Engineering
[HEADING] Mailing Address
At Brown University, you can pursue a master's degree in distinct engineering, technology and innovation disciplines through our world-renowned School of Engineering.
The School of Engineering at Brown emphasizes the power of interdisciplinary thought and recognizes that engineering is intertwined with every aspect of our lives.
Our School's unique methodology eliminates traditional barriers between engineering disciplines. We foster innovative faculty collaborations, forming diverse research teams and learning communities that unite engineers and non-engineers. Together, these multidisciplinary groups address critical challenges at the forefront of engineering and science.
You can pursue a master’s degree in the following engineering disciplines:
Since this range of programs is so broad, we strongly encourage you to explore the individual disciplines by selecting a program above. Upon starting your application, you'll be asked to select the specific program you wish to pursue.
Additional Information
Brown undergraduates can apply to a qualifying engineering program as a fifth-year master’s degree. Browse eligible programs.
Attend an Info Session
• A.M.
• M.Eng.
• Sc.M.
• Biomedical engineering
• Chemical engineering
• Data-enabled computational engineering and science
• Design engineering
• Electrical and computer engineering
• Environmental engineering
• Innovation management and entrepreneurship (Online or on-campus)
• Materials science and engineering
• Mechanical engineering & applied mechanics
• Sustainable energy
• Technology leadership (Online with residencies)
• Program Faculty
• Program Handbook
• Graduate School Handbook
[GRID_TABLE]
Graduate Programs
Engineering

M.Eng.
Sc.M.

pages.content:
[HEADING] Graduate Programs
[GRID_TABLE]
Graduate Programs
With more than 3,000 graduate and medical students and more than 700 full-time faculty members, Brown offers excellent academic training and mentoring within a supportive environment.
Graduate Programs

[HEADING] Fifth-Year Master’s Programs

[HEADING] Sustainable Energy
[HEADING] Interested in Learning More?
Continue for another year at Brown to earn your master’s degree.
Fifth-year students must complete the degree in two semesters, with the exception of those starting in the summer who must complete in three semesters. See below for participating programs, application process and deadlines.
Admission decisions are made by individual departments. Prospective applicants are encouraged to contact their intended master's program to ensure they have the coursework necessary to apply. Questions about the application process should be directed to masters_admissions@brown.edu.
Please note: the GRE requirement is waived for fifth-year applicants
Access the Master's Application
Please note: Undergraduate financial aid awards cannot be extended to apply to the fifth-year master’s program. Please contact your intended department/program for more information about financial aid or additional funding opportunities. You can estimate your cost of attendance and learn more about loan eligibility at Graduate Student Funding and Support.
Request additional information about continuing at the University for a master's degree after completing a bachelor's degree.
• Apply to a fifth-year master's program in their final year of undergraduate study at Brown
• Apply up to two approved courses taken as an undergraduate student towards their graduate degree
• Unofficial Transcripts
• Two Letters of Recommendation
• Personal Statement
• Resume/CV
[GRID_TABLE]
Fifth-Year Master's Programs
Fifth-Year Master’s Programs
Continue for another year at Brown to earn your master’s degree.
Fifth-Year Master’s Programs
Continue for another year at Brown to earn your master’s degree.





















Current students are eligible to:

Apply to a fifth-year master's program in their final year of undergraduate study at Brown
Apply up to two approved courses taken as an undergraduate student towards their graduate degree 

Fifth-year students must complete the degree in two semesters, with the exception of those starting in the summer who must complete in three semesters. See below for participating programs, application process and deadlines.









Admission decisions are made by individual departments. Prospective applicants are encouraged to contact their intended master's program to ensure they have the coursework necessary to apply. Questions about the application process should be directed to masters_admissions@brown.edu.Application Requirements:Unofficial TranscriptsTwo Letters of RecommendationPersonal StatementResume/CVPlease note: the GRE requirement is waived for fifth-year applicantsAccess the Master's Application













  Master's Program Benefits



  Discover the benefits of a fifth-year master's program and the application process unique to Brown undergraduates.


Request Information


























  Master's Student Support



  Discover a holistic student experience; build your network, connect with the community, and find the resources you need.


Discover Resources


























  Upcoming Events



  Join us for fifth-year master's information session or application office hours throughout the semester. 


Attend An Event
























Please note: Undergraduate financial aid awards cannot be extended to apply to the fifth-year master’s program. Please contact your intended department/program for more information about financial aid or additional funding opportunities. You can estimate your cost of attendance and learn more about loan eligibility at Graduate Student Funding and Support.

Continue for another year at Brown to earn your master’s degree.





















Current students are eligible to:

Apply to a fifth-year master's program in their final year of undergraduate study at Brown
Apply up to two approved courses taken as an undergraduate student towards their graduate degree 

Fifth-year students must complete the degree in two semesters, with the exception of those starting in the summer who must complete in three semesters. See below for participating programs, application process and deadlines.









Admission decisions are made by individual departments. Prospective applicants are encouraged to contact their intended master's program to ensure they have the coursework necessary to apply. Questions about the application process should be directed to masters_admissions@brown.edu.Application Requirements:Unofficial TranscriptsTwo Letters of RecommendationPersonal StatementResume/CVPlease note: the GRE requirement is waived for fifth-year applicantsAccess the Master's Application

The Graduate School Handbook defines the most important policies, procedures and practices that guide graduate education at Brown University.
The information and language in the handbook supersedes any conflicting information that may appear on the Graduate School website.
